top_comments.comment: Visit https://simplisafe.com/modustrial to learn more and to get at least 30% off your SimpliSafe security system!

comments_since_last_sample.body:
You've certainly got your work CUT OUT for you! 😂

I'll see myself out.
Finger pulls for sure. You'll have greasy fingerprints all over the cabinets if you do the push to open option
Don't you have to put a range hood over your cooktop? Is that something you were planning for the center island? It might break up your flow in this open concept floorplan...
I'd do push to open. If it doesn't make an annoying clicking sound. I rented a house with drawers/doors like that & it was nice!
Push first thats cool... Will your animals figure it out?
Go with the matt pulls.   Much more robust long term

I'm gain for the island, with cook top.
Second I also like multiple function units. The pull out drawers are fantastic idea use for the corner.
Island eating area a pull out and tuck it in when not in use I've seen in places
The cleanliness of no drawer pulls will look good, but as a practical matter, having handles is probably be the best route.
Awesome to keep seeing the progress you have made! Keep up the hard work Mike.
I like push to open, keeps everything looking really clean.

Push to open would be my choice, but keep in mind that they do stop working well (wear out) over time, so my suggestion is to get some spares in case they get discontinued. In my parents' house out of 12 of them 1-2 wend out after 10 years of use, which is not bad, but something to keep in mind.
I want to say you should do push to open that way everything is even.
